update.description:
* Create xacro macros for common WAMV-V sensors \(imu, gps, camera, planar lidar\), based on @brian\_bingham ’s nps\_robotx package.
* Add an example urdf using these macros \(again from nps\_robotx\)
* Add an example localization launch file which uses ROS’s ekf package to fuse imu and gps into a state estimation
* Publish joint states from thrust plugin so rviz can visualize the propellers
* Added an example rviz config / launch file to see the sensors and tf tree and test the localization

‌

![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/637660744-2018-06-28_11-56-12.gif)
‌
update.title: Add sensor macros and example

update.title: Add sensor macros and example

content.raw: Just one minor thing before merging. Could you update the `Changelog`?
content.html: Just one minor thing before merging. Could you update the Changelog?

content.raw:
Added the sensor visuals and multibeam to example. As the tutorials currently direct the user to create their own URDF to model their robot sensor’s \(the one in this PR is just an example\) I think we should hold off on the enable/disable flags until we have a preconfigured sensor suite for VMRC.

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/4061184173-sensor_geometry.png)
‌
content.html:
Added the sensor visuals and multibeam to example. As the tutorials currently direct the user to create their own URDF to model their robot sensor’s (the one in this PR is just an example) I think we should hold off on the enable/disable flags until we have a preconfigured sensor suite for VMRC.

‌

update.description:
* Create xacro macros for common WAMV-V sensors \(imu, gps, camera, planar lidar\), based on @brian\_bingham ’s nps\_robotx package.
* Add an example urdf using these macros \(again from nps\_robotx\)
* Add an example localization launch file which uses ROS’s ekf package to fuse imu and gps into a state estimation
* Publish joint states from thrust plugin so rviz can visualize the propellers
* Added an example rviz config / launch file to see the sensors and tf tree and test the localization

‌

update.title: Add sensor macros and example

content.raw: Would be helpful for visualization. I’ll add some simple geometries for now.
content.html: Would be helpful for visualization. I’ll add some simple geometries for now.

content.raw: Should we load the multibeam laser?
How hard would be to load a mesh of the sensor in simulation? If we don’t have an available mesh, it’s fine to use a simple shape for now. We could create a nicer mesh in the future.
content.html: How hard would be to load a mesh of the sensor in simulation? If we don’t have an available mesh, it’s fine to use a simple shape for now. We could create a nicer mesh in the future.

content.raw:
Would be possible to have a flag to enable/disable each sensor individually? Something like this:

      <arg name="laser_enabled" default="false"/>
      <arg name="kinect_enabled" default="false"/>
    
      <include file="$(find husky_gazebo)/launch/spawn_husky.launch">
        <arg name="laser_enabled" value="$(arg laser_enabled)"/>
        <arg name="kinect_enabled" value="$(arg kinect_enabled)"/>
      </include>

Maybe this way, we only need a single URDF file.
content.html:
Would be possible to have a flag to enable/disable each sensor individually? Something like this:

  <arg name="laser_enabled" default="false"/>
  <arg name="kinect_enabled" default="false"/>

  <include file="$(find husky_gazebo)/launch/spawn_husky.launch">
    <arg name="laser_enabled" value="$(arg laser_enabled)"/>
    <arg name="kinect_enabled" value="$(arg kinect_enabled)"/>
  </include>

Maybe this way, we only need a single URDF file.

content.raw: Should this file be named `wamv_multibeam_laser.xacro`? I think there's an extra `r` in the name.
content.html: Should this file be named wamv_multibeam_laser.xacro? I think there's an extra r in the name.

content.raw:
I'm launching the example URDF with all the sensors and I get the following warning when running the `localization_example.launch:`

`[ WARN] [1530838530.754144569, 397.068000000]: Transform from base_link to odom was unavailable for the time requested. Using latest instead.`

Is it expected?
content.html:
I'm launching the example URDF with all the sensors and I get the following warning when running the localization_example.launch:

[ WARN] [1530838530.754144569, 397.068000000]: Transform from base_link to odom was unavailable for the time requested. Using latest instead.

Is it expected?

content.raw: Wasn’t needed, it seems \(compiles without it\)
Do you mind to update the tutorials to leverage all the great work done in this pull request?
content.html: Do you mind to update the tutorials to leverage all the great work done in this pull request?
